page.title: 05National Trust -Dorking NE
page.content: The{National Trust}has an information centre and shop at the top of{Box Hill.}It has about one and a half million visitors a year who escape for some peace,walking,for family picnics,for{nature trails}and also for the{scenery. The whole area covers about 2km by 3km.The Trust manage 1200 acres locally,own 27 leases and many houses.Their land consists of one third woodland(mainly{deciduous trees now),one third{downland}and one third road and track. { Box Hill}is of{Special Scientific {Interest}for its soils and plants. July and August are the busiest times of the year unless there is a lot of snow in winter when skiers come. { George Meredith}(the famous poet) lived at Flint Cottage on Box Hill and is supposed to haunt it to this day.
